_comment: Created by ianb on 16/12/2014 11:17:04 using v2.3
title: What are the trends in hospital admissions as a result of self-harm for children and young people?
analysis_commentary: Here we look at directly standardised rates of finished admission episodes for self-harm per 100,000 population aged 10-24 years. The rate of hospital admission has been continuously increasing over time. There has been an increase by approximately 7 % (from 330 to 352 admissions per 100,000) between 2007/2008 - 2009/2010 (pooled) and 2010/11-2012/13 (pooled).
data_source: Local Authority Child Health Profiles, ChiMat Health Intelligence Network
